metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4715 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: Yann Collet LZ4 before r119, when used on certain 32-bit platforms that allocate memory beyond 0x80000000, does not properly detect integer overflows, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted Literal Run, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-4611. It was discovered that LZ4 incorrectly handled integers. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code in grub2 is different, no indication it is vulnerable to the same issue. Marking as not-affected.

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '42.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
lz4 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.0~r131-2').
thunderbird package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
